abstract.para: &slereg; (&slea;) allows to upgrade an existing system to the new version, for example, going from &slea; 11 SP4 to the latest &slea; 12 service pack. No new installation is needed. Existing data, such as home and data directories and system configuration, is kept intact. You can update from a local CD or DVD drive or from a central network installation source.
This chapter explains how to manually upgrade your &sle; system, be it by DVD, network, an automated process, or &susemgr;.

sect1.title: Supported Upgrade Paths to &slea; &productnumber;
sect1.para: Before you perform any migration, read .

important.title: Cross-architecture Upgrades Are Not Supported
important.para: Cross-architecture upgrades, such as upgrading from a 32-bit version of &productname; to the 64-bit version, or upgrading from big endian to little endian are not supported!
Specifically, &slea; 11 on &ppc; (big endian) to &slea; &productnumber; on &ppc; (new: little endian!) is not supported.
Also, since &sle; &productnumber; is 64-bit only, upgrades from any 32-bit &sle; 11 systems to &sle; &productnumber; and later are not supported.
To make a cross-architecture upgrade, you need to perform a new installation.

note.title: Skipping Service Packs
note.para: Consecutively installing all Service Packs is the safest upgrade path. In some cases it is supported to skip 1 or 2 Service Packs when upgrading. However, we recommend to not skip any Service Pack.
Skipping Service Packs on &sled; is not supported. You need to consecutively install all Service Packs.

note.title: Upgrading Major Releases
note.para: We recommend to do a fresh install when upgrading to a new Major Release, for example from &sle; 11 to &sle; 12.

listitem.para: There is no supported direct migration path to &sle; &productnumber;. We recommend a fresh installation in this case.

varlistentry.term: Upgrading from &sle; 11 GA / SP1 / SP2 / SP3

listitem.para: If you cannot do a fresh install, first upgrade your installed &slea; 11 Service Pack to &slea; 11 SP4. These steps are described in the &sle; 11 Deployment Guide.
Upgrading from &slea; 11 SP4 is only supported via an offline upgrade. Refer to for details.
A direct upgrade from &slea; 12 GA / SP1 / SP2 to &slea; &productnumber; is not supported. You need to upgrade to &slea; 12 SP3 first.
Upgrading from &sle; 12 SP3 is only supported via an offline upgrade. Refer to for details.
Migrating from &opensuse; Leap 15 is supported. See . Only the server installation of Leap is supported for migration.
Upgrading from &sle; 12 SP2 and any older version is not supported.
Upgrading from &sle; 12 SP3 is only supported via an offline upgrade. Refer to for details.
